polygon.title: Polygon
polygon.text: A polygon is geometric shape that is made up of straight line segments. Polygons cannot contain any curved sides, or holes. For example, a square is a polygon but a circle is not.

internal-angle.title: Internal angles
internal-angle.text: The internal angles of a polygon are the angles on the inside, at every vertex.

concave.title: Polygone concave
concave.text: Un polygone concave a au moins un angle interne supérieur à 180 °. Au moins une des diagonales se situe en dehors de le polygone. Une façon courante d'identifier un polygone concave est de rechercher un côté «effondré» du polygone. Concave est l'opposé des polygones convexes.

convex.title: Polygone convexe
convex.text: Un polygone convexe ne contient aucun angle interne supérieur à 180 °. Toutes les diagonales se trouvent à l'intérieur du polygone. C'est l'opposé des polygones concaves.

regular-polygon.title: Regular polygon
regular-polygon.text: A regular polygon is a polygon in which all sides have the same length and all interior angles have the same size.

rectangle.title: Rectangle
rectangle.text: A rectangle is a quadrilateral in which all four angles are 90°.

rhombus.title: Rhombus
rhombus.text: A rhombus (the plural is rhombuses or rhombi) is a quadrilateral in which all sides have the same length.

parallel.title: Parallel lines
parallel.text: Two or more lines are parallel if they never intersect. They have the same slope and the distance between them is always constant.

venn-diagram.title: Venn Diagram
venn-diagram.text: A venn diagram visualises multiple properties or events that overlap.

polygon-diagonal.title: Diagonal
polygon-diagonal.text: A diagonal of a polygon is a line segment that connects two vertices that are not next to each other.

triangle-midsegment.title: Midsegment
triangle-midsegment.text: The midsegments of a triangle are the lines that connect the midpoints of different sides of the triangle.

parallelogram.title: Parallelogram
parallelogram.text: A parallelogram is a quadrilateral in which both pairs of opposite sides are parallel.

alternate-angles.title: Alternate angles
alternate-angles.text:
Alternate angles are formed by two parallel lines which are crossed by a traversal line, and they are always congruent. In the diagram below, each of the pairs of angles labelled 1, 2, 3 and 4 are alternate. The two angles in every pair lie on a different parallel line, and opposite sides of the traversal.

The angle pairs 1 and 2 are called alternate exterior angles, because they lie outside the parallel lines, and the angle pairs 3 and 4 are called alternate interior angles.

axis-of-symmetry.title: Axis of Symmetry
axis-of-symmetry.text: If a shape has reflectional symmetry, the axis of symmetry is the line that divides it into two equal halves.

triangle-sss.title: SSS condition for triangles
triangle-sss.text: Two triangles are congruent if their three sides have the same length. This is called the SSS congruence condition for triangles.

cpoct.title: CPOCT
cpoct.text: CPOCT signifie parties correspondantes de triangles congrus. Cela signifie que si deux triangles sont congrus, alors toutes leurs composantes correspondantes (angles, côtés, segments médians,…) doivent également être congruentes.

supplementary-angles.title: Supplementary angles
supplementary-angles.text: Two angles are supplementary if they add up to 180° (a semi-circle).

tessellation.title: Tessellation
tessellation.text: A tessellation is a geometric pattern that covers a surface without gaps or overlaps.

polygon-vertex.title: Vertex of a polygon
polygon-vertex.text: The vertices of a polygon are the points where its adjacent sides meet (its “corners”).

irregular-polygon.title: Irregular Polygon
irregular-polygon.text: An irregular polygon is one that is not regular. This means that either the sides or the angles don’t all have the same size.

polyhedron.title: Polyhedron
polyhedron.text: A polyhedron (the plural is polyhedra) is a 3-dimensional solid with no curves surfaces or edges. All faces of a polyhedron are polygons. For example, a cube and a pyramid are polyhedra, but a sphere is not.

polyhedron-face.title: Face of a polyhedron
polyhedron-face.text: The faces of a polyhedron are the polygons which make up its surface.

polyhedron-edge.title: Edge of a polyhedron
polyhedron-edge.text: The edges of a polyhedron are the line segments where two of its faces are connected.

polyhedron-vertex.title: Vertex of a polyhedron
polyhedron-vertex.text: The “corners” of a polyhedron are called its vertices.

platonic-solid.title: Platonic solid
platonic-solid.text: A Platonic solid is a polyhedron where every face is a regular polygon with the same number of edges, and where the same number of faces meet at every vertex. There are only five different Platonic solids: the Tetrahedron, Cube, Octahedron, Dodecahedron and Icosahedron.

equilateral-triangle.title: Triangle équilatéral
equilateral-triangle.text: Un triangle équilatéral est un triangle dans lequel les trois côtés ont la même longueur.

archimedean-solid.title: Archimedean solid
archimedean-solid.text: An Archimedean solid is a polyhedron made up of different kinds of regular polygons, that looks the same from every direction. There are 13 different Archimedean solids.

icosahedron.title: Icosahedron
icosahedron.text: The Icosahedron is a Platonic solid and consists of 20 faces that are all equilateral triangles. It has 12 vertices and 30 edges.

truncated-icosahedron.title: Truncated Icosahedron
truncated-icosahedron.text: The Truncated Icosahedron is an Archimedean solid consisting of 12 regular pentagons and 20 regular hexagons.

tetrahedron.title: Tetrahedron
tetrahedron.text: The Tetrahedron is a Platonic solid and consists of four faces that are equilateral triangles. It has four vertices and six edges.

cube.title: cube
cube.text: Un cube (parfois appelé hexaèdre) est un polyèdre régulier dans lequel chaque face est un carré. C'est l'un des cinq solides platoniciens, et il a 6 faces, 8 sommets et 12 arêtes.

octahedron.title: Octahedron
octahedron.text: The Octahedron is a Platonic solid and consists of 8 faces that are equilateral triangles. It has 6 vertices and 12 edges.

probability.title: Probability
probability.text: A probability is number between 0 and 1 that indicates the likelihood of the occurrence of certain event. The probability of an event A is written as PA.

congruent.title: Congruence
congruent.text: En géométrie, deux figures sont congruentes si elles sont identiques en taille, forme et mesure. Cela signifie que nous pourrions les déplacer, les retourner ou les faire pivoter pour qu'elles s'emboîtent exactement les unes sur les autres.

angle-bisector.title: Angle bisector
angle-bisector.text: An angle bisector is a line or ray that splits an angle in half, into two congruent, smaller angles.
